column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - Customized panel
column3: Knowing the origin of the tumor is essential in determining the type ?€? epithelial or mesenchymal and the behavior of the tumor.

column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - FFPE Mouse Panel- per slide
column3: Analyzing protein biomarkers through spatial profiling of individual cells is a well-established technique employed by cancer researchers to gain insights into the intricacies of the tumor microenvironment (TME). While this methodology has primarily been designed for human tissue samples, the extensive utilization of mouse models in the field of immuno-oncology (IO) warrants the adaptation of spatial profiling techniques for their application in mice.

column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - Immune Activation & Proliferation Module - per slide
column3: Finding new ways of understanding and characterizing immune escape and activation mechanisms of the tumor could lead to the development of new immunotherapies and enhance our understanding of cancer biology.

column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - Immune Profiling Core Panel - per slide
column3: Deciphering tumor immune biology begins with determining the status of the immune cells. The immune profiling panel serves as the core panel for spatial discoveries consisting of 15 critical immune protein biomarkers enabling you to characterize the immune system.

column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - Lymphocyte Profiling Module - per slide
column3: B-cells and T-cells play a crucial role in immune surveillance by recognizing and targeting tumor cells.

column1: Spatial Biology:Spatial Biology Panels - Tissue Architecture Module - per slide
column3: Knowing the origin of the tumor is essential in determining the type ?€? epithelial or mesenchymal and the behavior of the tumor.
